etymology.description: 束 “tie” + 八 “division, individually”; original meaning ‘to pick/select/choose’ (later written 揀/拣).
etymology.interpretation: A tied bundle (束) being opened or divided (八) suggests taking something out, hence the idea of selecting. The choosing sense later migrated to 揀/拣, while 柬 remains in compounds like 请柬 and the country name 柬埔寨.

examples.chinese: 我收到婚礼请柬(我收到婚禮請柬)。
公司向嘉宾发出请柬(公司向嘉賓發出請柬)。
examples.english: The company sent invitation cards to the guests.

examples.chinese: 柬埔寨简称“柬”(柬埔寨簡稱「柬」)。
